msContents.summary: A copy of the grammar of the Common Tamil composed in 1728 Latin by the Italian Jesuit Giuseppe Costantino Beschi (1680-1747).

filiation.p: BnF Indien 191 contains its French translation.

msItem.author: Beschi
msItem.incipit:
Religiosis Tamulicæ linguæ
Candidatur.
C. J. Beschius salutem in D ̄no
Pluries audici vulgarem linguæ Thamulicæ grammaticam criminantes
ut et ego exemplum vestrum sequutus, in ejus vineâ non inerti socordiâ sedeam. Valete.
Missne Madurensi, IV kal. Jan. M.D.CCXXVIII
msItem.explicit: Sciant, quid bene loquendum sit, et posiut vel incolas reprehendere, si errent, cetera nullo labore edocebit usus.

support.p: Industrial paper with watermark also found in other manuscripts (i.e. Indien 189, Indien 192, and Indien 617, 634; see Colas and Colas-Chauhan 1995: 51). It is represented by the letter T surmounted by a crown and placed on a base, itself surmounting a cartouche which contains a J followed by a fleur-de-lis and the name CUSSON (cf. nos. 3292 and 3293, pl. 424 and no. 694, pl 109 in Heawood 1969 [1950]).

supportDesc.foliation: Library roman pagination 1-89 on the upper side (right and left) of each page of U1b.

collation.desc: the front cover. Cover board: register number = unreadable. Shelfmark on verso.
46 folios = Grammar of Low Tamil, by Beschi.
1 folio = Grammar of Low Tamil: Title Page. Shelfmark written in black pencil: "Tamoul n° 190"
45 folios = Grammar of Low Tamil: Main Text. Library roman pagination 1-89. 89 written pages + 1 blank page.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

layoutDesc.layout: The layout of the page is organized into two rectangules drawn in grey prencil within which the text is organised into two columns. Upper, bottom, right, and left margins: 100 mm.

desc.p: It seems Jean Calmette's hand (1692–1739 or 40) (cf. fond Brotier 89, ff. 21a, 25a, 51a) – who had copied some of the manuscript that were sent from India and entered the Royal library – see his letter from Ballabaram, August, 1731 in fond Brotier 89, fol. 37a, 37b [non vidi, cited in Colas and Colas-Chauhan 1995: 11).

The vowel lenght of e/o is marked with a diacritic consisting in a stroke placed above the V. The same stroke is also used above C to mark that it should be read as accompained by the vowel a or a long vowel.
The puḷḷi appears as a small circle above consonants in intermediate position.
The symbols for ra and long a is not differentiated.

decoNote.desc: Used to mark the beginning of a new paragraph.

additions.desc: Note in black ink n. 202 (front cover, recto). This corresponds to the number of the MS in CCMBR. See also BnF Indien 192.
BnF shelfmark sticker INDIEN 190 on front cover, verso.
BnF shelfmark in black pencil Tamoul N° 190 on f[1]r.

A.M.D.G. Grammatica Latino Tamulica
ubi de vulgari Tamulicæ linguæ
idiomate கொடுனதமிழ
Dicto in gratiam recentium soc. Jesu missionarior.
Auctore R. P. Constantio Jos. Beschio
ejusdem societ: in madurensi Regno missionario
anno dom. 1728.

desc.p: The stamp (size 200 mm) is found on the title page and at p[90]: 3 fleur-de-lys in an oval emblem surmounted by a crown. Inscription Royal Library. Period: Restoration, July 1830 - January 1831 (Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282, n. 20).

additions.desc: Preface entitled Religiosos Tamuliæ linguæ Candidatur. C. J. Beschio salutem in Dño (pp. 2-3).

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Conservative. Hence, puḷḷi, ō, and ē are used only if they are found in the manuscript. ― Abbreviations ― cf. = compare, f = folio, ff. = folios, r = recto, U/u = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
